title: Niall Horan slams England fans as Joe Sugg and Jack Whitehall celebrate
text:
Niall branded England fans ‘unbearable’ (Picture: Getty/Rex)

Niall Horan has made it clear that he’s less than impressed with English rugby fans, branding them ‘unbearable’ amid the team’s win against New Zealand.

Safe to say, he’s not too happy.

‘The thoughts of listening to so called English rugby fans now, makes me sick,’ he wrote on Twitter.

The former One Direction star later clarified to a fan: ‘[The team] are phenomenal. One of the best performances I’ve seen in a long time but…… the fans will be unbearable.’

Alrighty, then.

He wasn’t too happy (Picture: Twitter)

However, many English celebs have used the win as a brilliant excuse for a spot of celebration.

Strictly’s Joe Sugg, who’s made no secret of the fact that he’s a huge rugby fan, summed up everyone’s feelings by writing: ‘What. A. Game.’

Taking to Instagram, he let it all out as he screamed: ‘They’re in! Yo! Come on England!’

Lucky Jack Whitehall secured tickets to the final as he tweeted: ‘That was amazing! I’m off to the airport to watch England in a World Cup final. What a dream. #ENGvNZL.’

‘How proud am I to be English! Well done England,’ Frank Bruno said. ‘Against all the odds. Cant wait till next Saturday but will it be against the Welsh? Have a good weekend everyone.’

Man Of Steel star Henry Cavill shared a snap of himself enjoying the match during half time, as he wrote: ‘Half time for the biggest match of the Rugby World Cup 2019 so far!! England Vs New Zealand.

Celebs were loving the game (Pictures: Twitter)

‘England have come out swinging!!! Everything to play for still. The All Blacks (New Zealand) are always dangerous…..and so are we. C’Mon England!!!’

And Ross Kemp’s shouty celebration was just a sight to behold. We never expected anything else tbh.

However, Thor: Ragnarok director Taika Watiti wasn’t too happy about his country’s loss.

‘You think we trippin’ on the rugby? This is all part of our 72 year plan. And England fell right into our trap,’ he declared.

‘It was never about Japan. Jokes on you! You’ll be laughing on the other side of your face in 72 years! We play the long game sucka! Hahaha hahaha.’

Sure thing, Taika.

At full time, the score was a whopping 19 to England, while New Zealand lagged behind on 7, with the boys going on to play in the final.
